CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP - DTDPP: This is a conjugated polymer mentioned several times in the paragraph. It is based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole.
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu): This is a new conjugated polymer synthesized in the study, which is a variant of PDTP - DTDPP with a different alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment.
3. 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione: This is a monomer used in the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
4. 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole: This is another monomer used in the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
5. CHCl3: This is a solvent mentioned in the paragraph, specifically used for the good solubility of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
6. chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene: These are solvents mentioned in the paragraph, specifically used for the partial solubility of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
7. PC 70 BM: This is a fullerene derivative mentioned in the paragraph, used in the fabrication of bulk heterojunction-type polymer solar cells with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDTP - DTDPP
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)
3. 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione
4. 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole
5. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (synthesized using Stille reaction)
6. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) (has good solubility in CHCl3, partial solubility in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene, Mn = 18.9 kg / mol, PDI = 2.04)

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| PDTP - DTDPP |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |

| 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole |

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. This new polymer , referred to as PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , is designed to fulfill the abovementioned requirements simultaneously as much as possible. As a result , bulk heterojunction - type polymer solar cells based on PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PC 70 BM have broad photocurrent response wavelength range from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The polymer has good solubility in CHCl 3 but is only partly soluble in chlorobenzene and o-dichlorobenzene. The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP - DTDPP: A conjugated polymer based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole.
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu): A new donor-acceptor alternative conjugated polymer with n-butyl alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP.
3. 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione: A monomer used in the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
4. 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole: A monomer used in the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
5. CHCl3: A solvent with the molecular formula of trichloromethane.
6. CHlorobenzene: A solvent with the molecular formula of chlorobenzene.
7. o-Dichlorobenzene: A solvent with the molecular formula of 1,2-dichlorobenzene.
8. PC 70 BM: A fullerene derivative used in the fabrication of bulk heterojunction-type polymer solar cells.
9. Scheme 1: A schematic representation of the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) via a Stille reaction.
10. Figure 1: A graphical representation of the thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
11. Mn: Number-average molecular weight of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
12. PDI: Polydispersity index of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PDTP - DTDPP: A conjugated polymer.
2. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu): A new donor-acceptor alternative conjugated polymer.
3. Mn: Number-average molecular weight of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
4. PDI: Polydispersity index of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
5. Broad photocurrent response wavelength range: The range of wavelengths that the polymer absorbs light and generates photocurrent.
6. Shortcircuit current: The electric current that flows through a photovoltaic cell when the voltage is zero.
7. PCE: Power conversion efficiency of the polymer solar cell.

| --- |
| Broad photocurrent response wavelength range |
| Number-average molecular weight (Mn) |
| Polydispersity index (PDI) |
| Shortcircuit current |
| Power conversion efficiency (PCE) |
| High shortcircuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2) |
| Wavelength of 1 μm |
| External quantum efficiency (EQE) in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm |
| Open circuit voltage (VOC) |
| LUMO energy level |
| HOMO energy level |
| Carrier mobility |
| Good solubility |
| Appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives |

Paragraph: 8 The photocurrent response of all of these polymers extends to a wavelength of 1 μm ; however , the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of these PSCs in the wavelength range between 650 and 1100 nm is typically less than 10% , which results in low overall PCEs under AM1.5 simulated solar light. Up to now , the highest PCE of μmR - polymer was just 1.1% , based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine) by using complicated doubled active layers photovoltaic devices. 7 The fundamental requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR - polymers include the following : ( a ) broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm to absorb more sunlight ; ( b ) a high LUMO energy level to allow effective photoinduced charge transfer from the polymers to the acceptor in the BHJ device and at the same time , a low HOMO level to keep the open circuit voltage ( V OC ) as high as possible ; ( c ) high carrier mobility to ensure that effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes suppresses photocurrent loss ; and ( d ) good solubility and appropriate compatibility with fullerene derivatives to form high - quality films by solution processing. The lack of successful photovoltaic μmR - polymers might be due to the difficulty of fulfilling all these requirements simultaneously with one polymer. Very recently , 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dialkylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione ( DTDPP ) was shown to be a promising building block for the design of photovoltaic polymers. 9 In our previous work , we also found the polymer , PDTP - DTDPP , based on DTDPP and dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole was one of potential μmRpolymers. The PCE based on this polymer arrived 1.1% , one of highest value for μmR-polymers. 10 Herein , we present a new donor - acceptor alternative conjugated polymer , changing the alkyl chain in the diketopyrrolopyrrole segment of PDTP - DTDPP from 2-ethylhexyl to n-butyl. High shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved , which is a significant advance for efficient μmR-polymers. *Corresponding author. E-mail : hashimoto @ light.t.u - tokyo.ac.jp . Material Synthesis. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) was synthesized by coupling 3,6-di(2-bromothien-5-yl)-2 , 5dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c] pyrrole-1,4-dione and 2,6-di(trimethyl- tin)-N-[1-(2 0 -ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]- pyrrole via a Stille reaction ( Scheme 1 ). The number - average molecular weight ( M n ) of the polymer is 18.9 kg / mol with a polydispersity index ( PDI ) of 2.04. Let's think step by step.

1. The highest PCE of a μmR polymer was 1.1%, based on poly(di-2-thienylthienopyrazine). (unit: %)
2. The requirements for promising photovoltaic μmR polymers include broad absorption extending to or surpassing 1 μm, a high LUMO energy level, a low HOMO level, high carrier mobility, and good solubility and compatibility with fullerene derivatives. (no units)
3. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has a short circuit current of 14.87 mA / cm^2. (unit: mA / cm^2)
4. The new polymer PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has a PCE of 2.71%. (unit: %)
5. The number-average molecular weight (Mn) of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is 18.9 kg / mol. (unit: kg / mol)
6. The polydispersity index (PDI) of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is 2.04. (no unit)
7. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) plots of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) is shown in Figure 1. (no unit)
